speaker: cop_side
dialog: Seven years in Folsom.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: In the hole for three. McNeil before that.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: McNeil as tough as they say?

speaker: robber_front
dialog: You looking to become a penologist?

speaker: cop_front
dialog: You looking to go back? You know, I chase some crews, guys just lookin' to fuck up, got busted back. That you?

speaker: robber_side
dialog: You must've worked some dipshit crews.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: I worked all kinds.

speaker: robber_front
dialog: You see me doing thrill-seeker liquor store holdups with a "Born to Lose" tattoo on my chest?

speaker: cop_front
dialog: No, I do not.

speaker: robber_front
dialog: Right.

speaker: robber_smile
dialog: I am never going back.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: Then don't take down scores.

speaker: robber_front
dialog: I do what I do best. I take scores. You do what you do best trying to stop guys like me.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: So you never wanted a normal-type life?

speaker: robber_smile
dialog: What the fuck is that? Barbecues and ballgames?

speaker: cop_smile
dialog: Yeah.

speaker: robber_side
dialog: This regular-type life like your life?

speaker: cop_side
dialog: My life? No, my life...

speaker: cop_front
dialog: No, my life's a disaster zone.

speaker: cop_side
dialog: Because I spend all my time...

speaker: cop_front
dialog: chasing guys like you around the block.

speaker: cop_smile
dialog: That's my life.

speaker: robber_side
dialog: A guy told me one time: "Don't get yourself attached to anything you are not willing to walk out on in 30 seconds flat if you feel the heat around the corner."

speaker: robber_front
dialog: Now if you're on me and you gotta move when I move, how do you expect to keep... a marriage?

speaker: cop_side
dialog: Well, that's an interesting point.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: What are you, a monk?

speaker: robber_front
dialog: I have a woman.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: What do you tell her?

speaker: robber_front
dialog: I tell her I'm a salesman.

speaker: cop_side
dialog: So then, if you spot me around the corner, you're just gonna walk out on this woman?

speaker: cop_front
dialog: Not say goodbye?

speaker: robber_front
dialog: That's the discipline.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: That's pretty vacant, no?

speaker: robber_side
dialog: Yeah, it is what it is.

speaker: robber_smile
dialog: It's that or we both better go do something else, pal.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: I don't know how to do anything else.

speaker: robber_side
dialog: ...neither do I.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: I don't much want to either.

speaker: robber_front
dialog: Neither do I.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: You know, we're sitting here, you and I, like a couple of regular fellows. You do what you do. I do what I gotta do.

speaker: cop_side
dialog: And now that we've been face to face...

speaker: cop_front
dialog: If I am there and I got to put you away, I won't like it. But, I tell you, if it's between you and some poor bastard whose wife you're going to widow, brother, you are going down.

speaker: robber_front
dialog: There's a flip side to that coin. What if you got me boxed in and I gotta put you down? Because no matter what, you will not get in my way.

speaker: robber_front
dialog: We've been face to face, yeah... but I will not hesitate. Not for a second.

speaker: cop_front
dialog: Maybe that's the way it'll be. Or who knows...?

speaker: robber_side
dialog: Or maybe...

speaker: robber_front
dialog: we'll never see each other again.
